doc.previous: The pattern of settlement in the county is diverse The Metropolitan Green Belt has effectively prevented the further sprawl of London into the county although it contains the new towns of Basildon and Harlow originally developed to resettle Londoners following the destruction of London housing in World War II since which significantly developed and expanded Epping Forest also acts as a protected barrier to the further spread of London Because of its proximity to London and the economic magnetism which that city exerts many of Essex s settlements particularly those on or within short driving distance of railway stations function as dormitory towns or villages where London workers raise their families
